p: Several reports of clinical trials currently underway, but not yet peer-reviewed, have claimed that convalescent plasma from recovered patients displays neutralizing activity, which could be transferred to recipients by plasma infusion ( Shen etÂ al., 2020). In addition, monoclonal antibodies against the receptor-binding domain of the spike protein derived from convalescent patients have displayed neutralizing activity in a pseudovirus model and also protected against reinfection in animal models after recovery and re-challenge ( Bao et al., 2020; Ju et al., 2020).
